questions.question: What is the inciting incident in the story?

choices.answer: Charlie is chosen to undergo the experimental operation to improve his IQ.
Charlie begins to document his progress in reports.
Charlie wakes up from the operation.
Charlie begins to race Algernon in the mazes.

questions.question: The climax of the story occurs when…

choices.answer: Charlie notices signs of his own regression.
Charlie discovers that his friends at work aren’t really friends after all.
Charlie realizes that he is in love with Miss Kinnian.

questions.question: Which event below occurs during the falling action?

choices.answer: Charlie begins research in the lab on the procedure he had.
Charlie beats Algernon in the maze for the first time.
Charlie gets his old job back.

questions.question: After which event did Charlie decide he wanted to do work in the field of increasing human intelligence levels?

choices.answer: Charlie figures out a new way to line up machines at the factory.
Charlie stands up for the developmentally disabled dishwasher in the diner.
Charlie retakes the inkblot test and is successful in completing the test t

questions.question: The story includes allusions to all of the following except…
Who first discovers that Charlie may lose his intelligence?
What is the first sign that Algernon is regressing?

choices.answer: Algernon refuses to run the maze.

questions.question: Why does Dr. Nemur want the experiment to be successful?

choices.answer: Dr. Nemur wants for Charlie to retain his intelligence so that he can work
Dr. Nemur’s main concern is for Charlie’s well-being.
Dr. Nemur wants recognition in the scientific community.
Dr. Nemur’s main concern is that he has enough money to keep the laboratory

questions.question: What motivates Charlie Gordon most in the story?

choices.answer: his desire to impress Mr. Donnegan
his desire to beat Algernon in the maze

questions.question: Which of the following can be considered a theme of “Flowers for Algernon?”

choices.answer: You have to work hard, but anyone can be intelligent.
All humans deserve to be treated with dignity.

questions.question: During the Rorschach (inkblot) test at the beginning of the story, what is Charlie afraid of?

choices.answer: the mean man who administered the test

questions.question: Why do Dr. Nemur and Dr. Strauss choose Charlie?
What does it mean to “pull a Charlie Gordon?”
When Charlie is given his own lab, he starts sleeping…

choices.answer: on a cot in the lab.

questions.question: In his lab research,  what conclusion does Charlie reach?

choices.answer: Charlie’s newly gained intelligence is permanent
Charlie’s newly gained intelligence will fade away.
Charlie will only grow smarter and smarter.
Charlie will become smarter, but Algernon will continue to decline.
places him back in the maze.

questions.question: At the end of the story, Charlie…

choices.answer: tells Miss Kinnian that he loves her.
sues Dr. Strauss and the psychology department.
